name: Set-DCShadowPermissions
description: Modify AD objects to provide minimal permissions required for DCShadow.

name: HTTP-Backdoor
description: A backdoor which can receive instructions from third party websites and execute PowerShell scripts in memory.

name: DNS_TXT_Pwnage
description: A backdoor which can receive commands and PowerShell scripts from DNS TXT queries, execute them on a target, and be remotely controlled using the queries.

name: Execute-OnTime
description: A backdoor which can execute PowerShell scripts at a given time on a target.

name: Gupt-Backdoor
description: A backdoor which can receive commands and scripts from a WLAN SSID without connecting to it.

name: Add-ScrnSaveBackdoor
description: A backdoor which can use Windows screen saver for remote command and script execution.

name: Invoke-ADSBackdoor
description: A backdoor which can use alternate data streams and Windows Registry to achieve persistence.

name: Add-RegBackdoor
description: A backdoor which uses well known Debugger trick to execute payload with Sticky keys and Utilman (Windows key + U).

name: Set-RemoteWMI
description: Modify permissions of DCOM and WMI namespaces to allow access to a non-admin user.

name: Set-RemotePSRemoting
description: Modify permissions of PowerShell remoting to allow access to a non-admin user.

name: Invoke-AmsiBypass
description: Implementation of publicly known methods to bypass/avoid AMSI.

name: Out-CHM
description: Create infected CHM files which can execute PowerShell commands and scripts.

name: Out-Word
description: Create Word files and infect existing ones to run PowerShell commands and scripts.

name: Out-Excel
description: Create Excel files and infect existing ones to run PowerShell commands and scripts.

name: Out-HTA
description: Create a HTA file which can be deployed on a web server and used in phishing campaigns.

name: Out-Java
description: Create signed JAR files which can be used with applets for script and command execution.

name: Out-Shortcut
description: Create shortcut files capable of executing PowerShell commands and scripts.

name: Out-WebQuery
description: Create IQY files for phishing credentials and SMB hashes.

name: Out-JS
description: Create JS files capable of executing PowerShell commands and scripts.

name: Out-SCT
description: Create SCT files capable of executing PowerShell commands and scripts.

name: Out-SCF
description: Create a SCF file which can be used for capturing NTLM hash challenges.

name: Enable-DuplicateToken
description: When SYSTEM privileges are required.

name: Remove-Update
description: Introduce vulnerabilities by removing patches.

name: Invoke-PsUACme
description: Bypass UAC.

name: Download-Execute-PS
description: Download and execute a PowerShell script in memory.

name: Download_Execute
description: Download an executable in text format, convert it to an executable, and execute.

name: Execute-Command-MSSQL
description: Run PowerShell commands, native commands, or SQL commands on a MSSQL Server with sufficient privileges.

name: Execute-DNSTXT-Code
description: Execute shellcode in memory using DNS TXT queries.

name: Out-RundllCommand
description: Execute PowerShell commands and scripts or a reverse PowerShell session using rundll32.exe.

name: Check-VM
description: Check for a virtual machine.

name: Copy-VSS
description: Copy the SAM file using Volume Shadow Copy Service.

name: Invoke-CredentialsPhish
description: Trick a user into giving credentials in plain text.

name: Get-LSASecret
description: Get LSA Secret from a target.

name: Get-PassHashes
description: Get password hashes from a target.

name: Get-WLAN-Keys
description: Get WLAN keys in plain text from a target.

name: Keylogger
description: Log keystrokes from a target.

name: Invoke-MimikatzWdigestDowngrade
description: Dump user passwords in plain on Windows 8.1 and Server 2012

name: Show-TargetScreen
description: Connect back and Stream target screen using MJPEG.

name: Invoke-Mimikatz
description: Load mimikatz in memory. Updated and with some customisation.

name: Invoke-Mimikittenz
description: Extract juicy information from target process (like browsers) memory using regex.

name: Invoke-SSIDExfil
description: Exfiltrate information like user credentials, using WLAN SSID.

name: Invoke-SessionGopher
description: Identify admin jump-boxes and/or computers used to access Unix machines.

name: Invoke-Interceptor
description: A local HTTPS proxy for MITM attacks.

name: Create-MultipleSessions
description: Check credentials on multiple computers and create PSSessions.

name: Run-EXEonRemote
description: Copy and execute an executable on multiple machines.

name: Invoke-NetworkRelay
description: Create network relays between computers.

name: Invoke-Prasadhak
description: Check running hashes of running process against the VirusTotal database.

name: Brute-Force
description: Brute force FTP, Active Directory, MSSQL, and Sharepoint.

name: Port-Scan
description: A handy port scanner.

name: Powerpreter
description: All the functionality of nishang in a single script module.

name: Invoke-PsGcat
description: Send commands and scripts to specifed Gmail account to be executed by Invoke-PsGcatAgent

name: Invoke-PowerShellTcp
description: An interactive PowerShell reverse connect or bind shell

name: Invoke-PowerShellTcpOneLineBind
description: Bind version of Invoke-PowerShellTcpOneLine.

name: Invoke-PowerShellUdp
description: An interactive PowerShell reverse connect or bind shell over UDP

name: Invoke-PoshRatHttps
description: Reverse interactive PowerShell over HTTPS.

name: Invoke-PoshRatHttp
description: Reverse interactive PowerShell over HTTP.

name: Remove-PoshRat
description: Clean the system after using Invoke-PoshRatHttps

name: Invoke-PowerShellIcmp
description: An interactive PowerShell reverse shell over ICMP.

name: Invoke-JSRatRundll
description: An interactive PowerShell reverse shell over HTTP using rundll32.exe.

name: Invoke-JSRatRegsvr
description: An interactive PowerShell reverse shell over HTTP using regsvr32.exe.

name: Add-Exfiltration
description: Add data exfiltration capability to Gmail, Pastebin, a web server, and DNS to any script.

name: Add-Persistence
description: Add reboot persistence capability to a script.

name: Remove-Persistence
description: Remote persistence added by the Add-Persistence script.

name: Do-Exfiltration
description: Pipe (|) this to any script to exfiltrate the output.

name: Download
description: Transfer a file to the target.

name: Parse_Keys
description: Parse keys logged by the keylogger.

name: Invoke-Encode
description: Encode and compress a script or string.

name: Invoke-Decode
description: Decode and decompress a script or string from Invoke-Encode.

name: Start-CaptureServer
description: Run a web server which logs Basic authentication and SMB hashes.

name: ConvertTo-ROT13
description: Encode a string to ROT13 or decode a ROT13 string.

name: Out-DnsTxt
description: Generate DNS TXT records which could be used with other scripts.

name: Out-Shortcut
description: Create shortcut files capable of executing PowerShell commands and scripts.
